channel.title: CVE Feed for Siemens -- Development/Evaluation Kits for PROFINET IO: DK Standard Ethernet Controller
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Siemens -- Development/Evaluation Kits for PROFINET IO: DK Standard Ethernet Controller

item.title: CVE-2017-2680|2024-07-09T13:26:15.327Z -- siemens -- development%2Fevaluation%20kits%20for%20profinet%20io%3A%20dk%20standard%20ethernet%20controller
item.description: Specially crafted PROFINET DCP broadcast packets could cause a denial of service condition of affected products on a local Ethernet segment (Layer 2). Human interaction is required to recover the systems. PROFIBUS interfaces are not affected.

item.title: CVE-2017-2681|2024-07-09T12:03:51.980Z -- siemens -- development%2Fevaluation%20kits%20for%20profinet%20io%3A%20dk%20standard%20ethernet%20controller
item.description: Specially crafted PROFINET DCP packets sent on a local Ethernet segment (Layer 2) to an affected product could cause a denial of service condition of that product. Human interaction is required to recover the system. PROFIBUS interfaces are not affected. This vulnerability affects only SIMATIC HMI Multi Panels and HMI Mobile Panels, and S7-300/S7-400 devices.

item.title: CVE-2019-10936|2024-07-09T15:59:12.602Z -- siemens -- development%2Fevaluation%20kits%20for%20profinet%20io%3A%20dk%20standard%20ethernet%20controller
item.description:
Affected devices improperly handle large amounts of specially crafted UDP packets.
This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to trigger a denial of service condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-12741|2024-07-09T12:03:53.948Z -- siemens -- development%2Fevaluation%20kits%20for%20profinet%20io%3A%20dk%20standard%20ethernet%20controller
item.description: Specially crafted packets sent to port 161/udp could cause a denial of service condition. The affected devices must be restarted manually.

item.title: CVE-2019-13946|2024-07-09T12:03:58.088Z -- siemens -- development%2Fevaluation%20kits%20for%20profinet%20io%3A%20dk%20standard%20ethernet%20controller
item.description:
Profinet-IO (PNIO) stack versions prior V06.00 do not properly limit internal resource allocation when multiple legitimate diagnostic package requests are sent to the DCE-RPC interface. This could lead to a denial of service condition due to lack of memory for devices that include a vulnerable version of the stack.
The security vulnerability could be exploited by an attacker with network access to an affected device. Successful exploitation requires no system privileges and no user interaction. An attacker could use the vulnerability to compromise the availability of the device.
